result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:31 PM Apprs: CO: Crt Commissioner T. Heckmann for S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Bridges, Defendant Drake Allen Hermann in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for Drake Allen Hermann.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 22CF123 - PH, 21CF618 - STC, 21CF902 - STC, 21CM626 - STC. S/T Deputy Mangine. Direct by ADA Becker. Cross by Atty. Selmer. Court takes judicial notice of bond in 21CF902. Atty. argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Court confirms DE's address. Court approves Zoom appearance at PSC and arraignment for DE and Atty Selmer. Adjourned 2:52 PM srb

Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF618, 21CF902, 21CM626, & 22CF123 all set for PTC.  Court reviews files and notes 21CF618 and 22CF123 need to have PH.   Court reviews report filed by JSC that states DE did not call in when directed to.  Tina Sitz from JSC is here and recites phone number for DE.  ADA Ballo states 21CF618 was amended to Misdemeanors so no PH is needed on that file.  Court schedules 22CF123 for PH, the other files will be scheduled as PTC. DE to call JSC as soon as this matter wraps up.  DE gave clerk email address to send notice to.  DE confirms address.  bph

Includes 21CM626, 21CF902, 21CF618 and 22CF123.

-$200 on file in case 21CM626, Defendant to post additional $50 on 22CF123. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, LH, Hudson Home Depot, Wal-Mart, and Great Clips.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to call ONE time per week to verify address. Failure to call may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

08:11 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY:  Scott Selmer, DF:  Drake Allen Hermann appeared from jail. INCLUDES 21CF618, 21CF902, 21CM626 and 22CF123. Court reviews file. ADA Becker states that an offer was sent to Atty. Selmer to now include 22CF123. Court notes prelim needed on 22CF123. Atty. Selmer requests bond modification to signature bond. Court questions DE regarding transportation. DE states that he will have transportation. ADA Becker notes previous non-appearances, objects to signature bond. Court modifies bond. Court sets PH on 22CF123 and ARGN on 21CF902, other files for STC. Adjourned: 8:20 AM. kma
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.
